scheme_name: Intensive Fisheries Development Programme - Subsidy on Purchase of Fishing Nets (Scheduled Caste)
brief_description: The scheme aims to provide financial assistance to individuals from Scheduled Caste families engaged in fishing activities for the purchase of fishing nets. Under this scheme, a 60% subsidy or up to ₹24,000, on the purchase of fishing nets worth ₹40,000/- will be provided to eligible beneficiaries.
detailed_description: The &quot;Subsidy on Purchase of Fishing Nets&quot; is a scheme component under the Intensive Fisheries Development Programme, introduced by the Fisheries Department, Government of Haryana. The scheme aims to provide financial assistance to individuals from Scheduled Caste families engaged in fishing activities for the purchase of fishing nets. Under this scheme, eligible beneficiaries can avail a subsidy of up to 60% on the cost of fishing nets.
benefits: Financial Assistance is provided to Fish Farmers under the scheme:
Financial assistance of 60% subsidy on the purchase of fishing nets of amounting to ₹40,000/-. The maximum subsidy amount is ₹24,000/-.
Note: Subsidy is available only once in two years per beneficiary.
eligibility_criteria: The applicant should be a permanent resident of Haryana. The applicant should possess a valid Parivar Pehchan Patra (PPP). The applicant should belong to the Scheduled Caste (SC) category. The applicant should be at least 18 years old. The applicant should present a GST-paid bill for the purchase of fishing nets. The applicant can apply only once in two years for this subsidy.
